benchmark_details.name: DomainRAG: A Chinese Benchmark for Evaluating Domain-specific Retrieval-Augmented Generation
benchmark_details.overview: DomainRAG is designed to evaluate Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) models in a domain-specific context, focusing on college enrollment. It includes six sub-datasets that assess abilities such as conversational RAG, structural information analysis, faithfulness to expert knowledge, denoising, solving time-sensitive problems, and understanding of multi-document interactions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess crucial abilities of RAG models in a domain-specific scenario where traditional language models struggle.

data.source: Web pages from the admission official website of a Chinese university were crawled with official permission.
data.annotation: Manually generated and corrected question-answer pairs using LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparison of predicted answers to the ground truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in answering domain-specific questions.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated across several popular LLMs in domain-specific contexts.
